page.title: 07ACLE MARKET (CONTINUED)
page.content: GREAT YARMOUTH.NATURALLY MANY MARKET TRADERS ARE PREDICTING A DECLINE IN ATTENDANCES WITH THE OPENING OF THE PROPOSED BY-PASS. ACLE MARKET CANNOT HOPE TO COMPETE WITH THE LARGER AND MORE MODERN SITES AT YARMOUTH AND NORWICH,BUT, RATHER,ATTEMPTS TO PROVIDE A MORE GENUINE SERVICE FOR THE COMMUNITY. AS ONE STALL-HOLDER COMMENTED: "WE SELL JUNK,THEY SELL ANTIQUES,BUT THE ONLY REAL DIFFERENCE IS THEY CHARGE MORE!" MOST HOUSEWIVES IN ACLE PREFER TO BUY GROCERIES ON THE MARKET,NOT BECAUSE THEY ARE ANY BETTER OR ANY CHEAPER, BUT RATHER BECAUSE BY DOING SO THEY HAVE A CHANCE TO MEET THEIR FRIENDS,AND BECAUSE THEY FEEL THAT BY USING THE MARKET THEY ARE SUPPORTING LOCAL SMALL BUSINESSMEN.
